title.rendered: Vegan Fashion Week Returns to Los Angeles in October

content.rendered:
An Experience Designed to Empower Conscious Creatives and Solidify Los Angeles as The Ethical Fashion Destination


Vegan Fashion Week (VFW) returns to Los Angeles on October 8-9 for its third edition to present a curated lineup of international designers. This seasons theme, Expansion, explores the challenges our planet is facing through the lenses of fashion.

Revitalizing the historic heart of downtown Los Angeles to celebrate the citys creative essence, VFW is transforming the citys skyline into a backdrop for its fall fashion shows perched in the penthouse of the USC Tower, a 138 m skyscraper in the South Park neighborhood of Los Angeles, sister neighborhood of the Fashion District.

As the industry becomes increasingly more aware of fashion's intersection with social justice and environmental issues, VFW continues to further this dialogue by supporting designers that address matters from gender identity, to ethics and sustainability. In celebration of their diverse cultures and lifestyles, this years designers surpass industry standards of presenting impressive runway collections by offering solutions to pertinent issues plaguing the industry, like fashions carbon footprint, while simultaneously prioritizing the preservation of the environment and its animal inhabitants.

This seasons program includes four fashion shows with designers hailing from various countries and nationalities, including South Koreas Vegan Tiger, France's Julien Esteves Berthier, and for the first time Argentina will be represented by Buenos Aires-based Romina Cardillo and her brand Nous Etudions (Antispeciesist Brand, LVMH Prize Shortlists 2020). LA's very own Fan All Flames will present their new collection and local artist Parker Day will bring her photography to life on the runway to launch her first fashion brand, Pure Void.

Vegan Fashion Week is a snapshot of this buzzing unleashed creativity, waiting for the right platform to exist. We represent the voice of a generation that is tired of being green washed or fed elitist narratives, said Vegan Fashion Week founder and creative director, Emmanuelle Rienda It is not about being perfect, its about inspiring change and creating an ecosystem around values that are truly impactful for humans and non-humans. 

In addition to the fashion shows, Industry professionals and fashion lovers are invited to shop at Vegan World, a marketplace featuring a global curation of 20 animal-free, sustainable fashion designers. The public can join panel conversations featuring textile designer Desserto, a vegan cactus leather innovation from Mexico and a fashion film screening experience by LAFF.

VFW intends to reduce the impact of the event by minimizing the venue space usage, timeline of the event, mobility, transportation, packaging, energy use, and materials through precise waste management and solely providing vegan food and beverages. COVID-19 safety measures will be enforced in accordance with CDC guidelines.

For more information and schedule, visit www.veganfashionweek.org

Press contact: press@veganfashionweek.org

About Vegan Fashion Week

Vegan Fashion Week (VFW) was created in 2018 by LA-based French creative director Emmanuelle Rienda. Vegan Fashion Week has proven to be a historic event because of its unique message and global impact both in the media and the fashion industry. Vegan Fashion Week is held biannually in Los Angeles in March and October. Each season, Vegan Fashion Week welcomes leading international press, buyers and industry leaders across a global network for shows, presentations and events alongside a trade show and a conference focusing on ethics and sustainability. 


Website: www.veganfashionweek.org

Instagram: www.instagram.com/veganfashionweek
